bramspr.symboltable

Class SymbolTable<S extends Symbol>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bramspr.symboltable.SymbolTable<S>

  • public class SymbolTable<S extends Symbol>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a symbol table. It is used to keep track of declared variables, enumerated types, composite types and functions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentLevel
      The level of the current scope we are in.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Stack<S>> symbols
      A collection containing all declared symbols.
      private java.util.Stack<java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> symbolsInLevel
      A collection containing all symbols in a certain level, for closing scopes efficiently.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SymbolTable() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeScope()
      Closes the current scope.
      void declare(S symbol)
      Enters a symbol together with an entry into this symbol table using the current scope level.
      void openScope()
      Opens a new scope.
      S resolve(java.lang.String id)
      Get the Symbol-object matching a certain identifier / function signature whose level is the highest; in other words, that is declared most recently.

    • Field Detail

      • symbols

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Stack<S extends Symbol>> symbols
        A collection containing all declared symbols.

      • symbolsInLevel

        private java.util.Stack<java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> symbolsInLevel
        A collection containing all symbols in a certain level, for closing scopes efficiently.

        private int currentLevel
        The level of the current scope we are in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SymbolTable

        public SymbolTable()

    • Method Detail

      • openScope

        public void openScope()
        Opens a new scope.

      • closeScope

        public void closeScope()
        Closes the current scope. All symbols in the current scope will be removed from the symbol table.

      • declare

        public void declare(S symbol)
             throws SymbolTableException
        Enters a symbol together with an entry into this symbol table using the current scope level. The entry's level is set to currentLevel.
        Throws:
        SymbolTableException - When there is no valid current scope level, or when this symbol is already declared on the current level.

      • resolve

        public S resolve(java.lang.String id)
        Get the Symbol-object matching a certain identifier / function signature whose level is the highest; in other words, that is declared most recently.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier / function signature to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The latest symbol matching this identifier / function signature. null if the symbol table does not contain this symbol.
        Throws:
        SymbolTableException
